SUMMARY: The leisure and hospitality sector led hiring in December as restaurants added wait staff, cooks and bartenders ahead of the holidays.

TITLE: Retail spending increased 0.9% in April, boosted by demand and inflation
SUMMARY: Retail sales were expected to rise 1% in April, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: California's gas average tops $6 per gallon as prices surge across the U.S.
SUMMARY: California's state average for a gallon of gas hit a record above $6.

TITLE: CEO outlook dims sharply, with more than half expecting a recession ahead, survey shows
SUMMARY: The Conference Board measure of CEO sentiment showed that 57% expect the economy to sustain a "very short, mild recession."

TITLE: Households are now spending an estimated $5,000 a year on gasoline
SUMMARY: U.S. households are now spending the equivalent of $5,000 a year on gasoline, up from $2,800 a year ago, according to Yardeni Research.

TITLE: Weekly mortgage demand from homebuyers tumbles 12%, as higher interest rates take their toll
SUMMARY: Higher mortgage interest rates are hitting homebuyer affordability hard, and that is showing up in a sharp drop in mortgage applications.

TITLE: Powell says the Fed will not hesitate to keep raising rates until inflation comes down
SUMMARY: Fed Chair Jerome Powell said he will back interest rate increases until prices start falling back toward a healthy level.

TITLE: Fed Governor Christopher Waller says he's prepared to take rates past 'neutral' to fight inflation
SUMMARY: Fed Governor Christopher Waller said he would support hikes that pass through exceed the "neutral" level.

TITLE: Goldman says signs that inflation is peaking could be positive for stocks
SUMMARY: Signs that inflation is at least starting to abate from a 40-year high could be a positive for stocks, according to Goldman Sachs.

TITLE: The Fed’s favorite inflation measure rose 4.9% in April in a sign that price increases could be slowing
SUMMARY: The Fed's preferred inflation gauge rose 4.9% in April from a year ago, a still-elevated level that nonetheless indicated that price pressures could be easing.

TITLE: First-quarter GDP declined 1.5%, worse than thought; jobless claims edge lower
SUMMARY: The U.S. economic contraction to start the year was worse than expected as weak business and private investment failed to offset strong consumer spending.

TITLE: Fed minutes point to more rate hikes that go further than the market anticipates
SUMMARY: The rate-setting Federal Open Market Committee on Wednesday released the minutes from its May 3-4 meeting.

TITLE: Americans were worried about the economy even before inflation exploded, Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: The Fed's annual Survey of Household Economics and Decisionmaking showed that just 24% thought national economic conditions were good or excellent.

TITLE: Inflation-fighting Fed isn't focused on impact of rates on stocks, Esther George Says
SUMMARY: Central bank official noted that the Fed is looking to tighten financial conditions, and part of that is the stock market

TITLE: Fed's Mester says inflation hasn't peaked and multiple half-point rate hikes are needed
SUMMARY: Cleveland Fed President Loretta Mester said she doesn't see evidence that inflation has peaked and is on board with supporting multiple rate increases.

TITLE: Payrolls rose 390,000 in May, better than expected as companies keep hiring
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase 328,000 in May, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Fed Vice Chair Lael Brainard says it's 'very hard to see the case' for the Fed pausing rate hikes
SUMMARY: Fed Vice Chair Lael Brainard said it's unlikely the central bank will be taking a break from its current rate-hiking cycle anytime soon.

TITLE: Private payrolls increased by just 128,000 in May, the slowest growth of the recovery, ADP says
SUMMARY: Private sector employment rose by just 128,000 for the month, falling well short of the 299,000 Dow Jones estimate.

TITLE: Fed report sees 'slight or modest' economic growth as inflation surges
SUMMARY: Most of the U.S. has been seeing just "slight or modest" economic growth over the past two months or so, according to a Fed report Wednesday.

TITLE: The Fed's Mary Daly says rate hikes should continue until inflation is tamed
SUMMARY: San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly said she backs raising rates aggressively until inflation comes down.

TITLE: Job openings show sharp decline, but still vastly outnumber available workers
SUMMARY: The openings total declined by 455,000 from the upwardly revised March number to 11.4 million in April, according to the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey.

TITLE: Yellen says the administration is fighting inflation, admits she was wrong that it was 'transitory'
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen emphasized that the White House has several strategies that will reduce inflation she conceded is too high for Americans.

TITLE: Here's what the Federal Reserve's 0.75 percentage point rate hike — the highest in 28 years — means for you
SUMMARY: The Fed announced its highest rate hike in 28 years to fight inflation. Here's how that impacts your credit card, mortgage, car loan, student debt and savings.

TITLE: Here's what changed in the new Fed statement
SUMMARY: This is a comparison of Wednesday's Federal Open Market Committee statement with the one issued after the Fed's previous policymaking meeting on May 4.

TITLE: Fed hikes its benchmark interest rate by 0.75 percentage point, the biggest increase since 1994
SUMMARY: The Federal Open Market Committee released its decision on interest rates Wednesday, with markets expecting a three-quarter point hike.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve looks set to hike interest rates today. How raising rates may help slow inflation
SUMMARY: Consumers may not be looking forward to higher interest rates while they're paying more for necessities. Here's how raising rates helps inflation.

TITLE: Here's everything the Fed is expected to announce, including the biggest rate hike in 28 years
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday is expected to do something it hasn't done in 28 years — increase interest rates by three-quarters of a percentage point.

TITLE: Homebuilder sentiment drops to lowest level in two years as housing demand slows
SUMMARY: Builder sentiment is getting hit by higher interest rates, which are causing a slowdown in housing demand.

TITLE: The risk of recession is growing. Here's why recessions may be inevitable
SUMMARY: Experts argue that monetary policies have limits on what they can achieve against an impending recession.

TITLE: Retail sales posted unexpected 0.3% decline in May as inflation hammers consumers
SUMMARY: Advance retail and food service spending fell 0.3% for the month, below the Dow Jones estimate for a 0.1% gain.

TITLE: Mortgage demand is now roughly half of what it was a year ago, as interest rates move even higher
SUMMARY: Sharply rising interest rates are decimating refinance volume, and those rates, along with sky-high home prices, are hitting demand from buyers.

TITLE: Wholesale prices rose 10.8% in May, near a record annual pace
SUMMARY: Wholesale prices rose at a brisk pace in May as inflation pressures mounted on the U.S. economy, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported.

TITLE: Fed likely to boost interest rates by three-quarters of a point this week
SUMMARY: Markets are beginning to anticipate an even faster pace of rate hikes, and Fed officials apparently will satisfy growing expectations.

TITLE: Expectations for inflation and spending hit record levels in May, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: Consumer expectations for inflation and spending in the year ahead both hit record levels in May, the New York Federal Reserve reported Monday.

TITLE: Strong inflation, anxious consumers add up to more worries that recession has already arrived
SUMMARY: The case that a recession is looming over the U.S. got stronger Friday amid blistering inflation and historic lows in consumer sentiment.

TITLE: Inflation rose 8.6% in May, highest since 1981
SUMMARY: The consumer price index for May was expected to increase 8.3% from a year ago, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Bringing inflation down is going to take time, patience — and pain
SUMMARY: Tackling runaway inflation won't be easy and it won't be quick, and it may carry a steep price tag that is just beginning to be paid.

TITLE: Weekly jobless claims hit 229,000, the highest level since January
SUMMARY: First-time filings for the week ended June 4 totaled 229,000, well ahead of the 210,000 Dow Jones estimate.

TITLE: Mortgage demand falls to the lowest level in 22 years amid rising rates and slowing home sales
SUMMARY: Mortgage demand continues to fall as interest rates rise further and affordability in the housing market weakens.

TITLE: Fed GDP tracker shows the economy could be on the brink of a recession
SUMMARY: The Atlanta Fed's GDPNow tracker is now pointing to an annualized gain of just 0.9% for the second quarter.

TITLE: Housing wealth gains a record $1.2 trillion, but there are signs the market is cooling
SUMMARY: Two years of rapidly rising home prices have pushed the nation's collective home equity to new highs.

TITLE: Powell says the Fed could hike rates by 0.75 percentage point again in July
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said Wednesday the central bank could raise interest rates by a similar magnitude at the next policy meeting in July.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve just hiked interest rates by 0.75 percentage point. How raising rates may help slow inflation
SUMMARY: Consumers may not be looking forward to higher interest rates while they're paying more for necessities. Here's how raising rates helps inflation.

TITLE: U.S. recession isn't 'inevitable,' but inflation is 'unacceptably high,' Treasury Secretary Yellen says
SUMMARY: Talk of a recession has accelerated this year as inflation remains high and the Federal Reserve takes aggressive steps to counter.

TITLE: Inflation and recession fears are squeezing some industries more than others
SUMMARY: Inflation has been pushing prices higher, and shoppers are feeling the pressure as they pay more for goods like groceries and gas.

TITLE: Here are the three things the Fed has done wrong, and what it still isn't getting right
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve suddenly finds itself second-guessed as it tries to navigate the economy through inflation and away from recession.

TITLE: Fed promises 'unconditional' approach to taking down inflation in report to Congress
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials rolled out strong language Friday to describe their approach to inflation, promising a full-fledged effort to restore price stability.

TITLE: Powell vows that the Fed is 'acutely focused' on bringing down inflation
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Friday reiterated the central bank's commitment to bringing down inflation.

TITLE: Everyone knows inflation is on fire. This is what's really fueling it
SUMMARY: The three biggest inputs for the consumer price index, the most widely followed measure of inflation, are food, energy and shelter.

TITLE: A day after Powell's assurances about the economy, markets are worried that 'the Fed breaks something'
SUMMARY: The trouble is, the Fed's likely to get a recession anyway as data shows the economy is a far cry from stable.
